FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion.synopsis: Asrarion's evil ending, in which he plunges the city into darkness and gives it over to his vampire spawn.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach.synopsis: Karlach's evil ending, in which she opens portals and allows hell's hordes to slaughter the city that abandoned her. She tears out her heart and marches into hell to take vengeance on Zariel.

FinalDecision_Nested_Rule.synopsis: Final outcome of an evil ending where the player decides to take control and rule the world.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor.synopsis: Evil ending following END_BrainBattle_FinalDecision, if you urge the Emperor to rule using the netherbrain

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilGale.synopsis: Avatar Gale has declared his intention to destroy all gods. Using the token of Mystra he still has (her earring) he casts a spell upon the city of Baldur's Gate, 'awakening' them and inciting them to rid the city of religious worship. He opens a rift to the heavens and sets off to destroy the rest of the pantheon wiht his army of nautiloids in tow.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge.synopsis: Expanded evil branches for Dark Urge players taking control of the Netherbrain and deciding what comes next.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart.synopsis: Shadowheart's evil ending in which she executes clerics of Selune and Shar and becomes the prophet / founder of a new faith.
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart.how_to_trigger: -> Start game as Avatar Shadowheart-> Ctrl + 9 to Open Debug book-> Quests and Flags-> Act 3 (END)-> Master End Setup-> Agree to go to endgame-> Go back to master set up as above-> Skip Party configuration and do setup-> Emperor is mindflayer with stones-> Skip through following few options-> Choose to go to Defeat of Brain-> The Final decision scene will trigger-> Select the option to betray emperor and become the absolute-> Skip through rest of the scene into evil avatar scene-> Skip through until first question hold-> Chose fist option 'For too long, you allowed yourself...-> Evil Shadowheart will start here

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel.synopsis: Lae'zel's evil ending in which she chooses not to destroy the illithids, but instead rallies them to take Tu'nurath - either in her prince's name, or her own.

FinalDecision_Nested_Chaos.synopsis: Outcome of a final decision in the evil ending in which the player decides to psionically influence the city to collapse into chaos, and leave.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll.synopsis: Wyll evil ending, in which he sits the throne in Wyrm's Rock, passing judgement on the patriars before setting out to "unify" the rest of the coast.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_0.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_0.text: *The city has been saved - from the illithids, at least. Its citizens aren't so sure about you.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion surveys the wreckage of the street, the overawed, kneeling crowd.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_2.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_2.text: *But what should they fear? With the Absolute's power in your hands, you can rule them not just as a Grand Duke, but a king. A Sun King.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: As he passes, his body begins to shine from within. People watch, rapt.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion's body now blazes like the noonday sun. He has become the Sun King of the city, his head wreathed in a fiery crown. A small crowd watches on in awe - most notably, a young NOBLEMAN.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_5.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_5.text: *And you'll be a fair ruler - benevolent, even...*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion graciously welcomes the noble, who rises to his feet and approaches

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_4.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_4.text: *Although of course, where there's light, there's darkness too.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_4.context:
CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, screams. A wide shot over the city shows mists rolling through the streets, quenching all light. Where the mists pass, the blazing red eyes of vampire spawn bloom in the shadows. 
Soon the city is shrouded in darkness but for the single blazing beacon that is Astarion.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_3.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_3.text: *And just because you're a caring, benevolent leader, doesn't mean you can't treat yourself every now and then.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Back to the young NOBLEMAN, who shrinks from the darkness and turns to Astarion, hope in his eyes. Astarion smiles and beckons him forward into the light - before laughing and digging his fangs into the boy's neck. (NOTE: Both Astarion and nobleman's silhouettes needs to be very clear here)

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAstarion_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Darkness envelops the screen, leaving only Astarion's laughter - and the screams. (NOTE: Both Astarion and nobleman's silhouettes needs to be very clear here)

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Awestruck gaze up at Karlach, who glares at them. Psionics pulse out, and the masse's expression shift to unease as they sense Karlach's mood.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_2.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_2.text: Look at them. Afraid. They've always been afraid of me.
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach watches back, eyes flicking from one face to the next as her expression moves through surprise, hurt, then sullen fury.NodeContext: Cold

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_3.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_3.text: You made Gortash your saviour. He'd keep you safe, wouldn't he? Safe from people like me.
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: She jerks her head, rage drawing her face taut. We move around her in a circle as she stares down the onlookers. Bitter irony in her voice - keep them safe from HER.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_6.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_6.text: Well guess what, Baldur's Gate? You can't pick which parts of you to keep. Everything you reject will come back. Stronger.
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera comes to rest with Karlach facing down the camera, burning hot as we've ever seen. Over her shoulder, the Netherbrain rises again and begins to glow.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_9.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_9.text: I'm home! I'm finally home! Oh, you must've missed me so much! But don't worry - I made friends while I was gone! Want to meet them?
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: After speaking Karlach raises her armNodeContext: Sarcasm, bitterness, and rage - she's about to unleash hell on them. Finally speaking out. Maybe a saccharine bitterness here - feigning happiness in the most threatening way possible.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: All around Karlach, portals swirl into form - and through them, imps and devils turn to take heed of the helpless crowd. Catching the scent, they leap through, weapons raised.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Back to Karlach, gaze fixed ahead as screams rise all around - and then fade away.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Same shot as the first, Karlach standing in the centre of a ring. Only now it isn't civilians, but devils - bowing, awaiting her next orders.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_5.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilKarlach_5.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She digs a hand into her chest (OOS), grits her teeth and wrenches - pulls out the heart. 

Karlach throws her heart aside as her flames lose their orange hue, and take on the same colouring as the Netherbain's magic.

Greasy smile. NodeContext: Evil sarcasm. She's going to go kick Zariel's ass.

FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Among the awestruck, kneeling crowds, we focus on one woman in particular.She cringes and averts her gaze.

FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_9.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_9.text: *You could easily rule through fear. But just as easily through love.*
FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Psionics wash over the crowd

FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Time cut: still on the woman from the crowd, only now she is crouched examining some fresh produce at a stall. She looks healthy and happy as she picks out some items.

FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_5.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wider, and we see it's market day in Baldur's Gate. It's idlyllic, with bright sunshine, happy people wandering stalls, birdsong, bunting and more. A child runs by, carrying a ball.

FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The woman stands up from her crouched position at the stall, holding her bag of pickings - we suddenly cut back to the grim reality. The woman, dressed in rags and sporting bloodied hands, carries an armful of rubble. She turns to join a line of other enslaved baldurians, including the child we saw with the ball, now replaced by a large stone. Around them, the city looks grey and foreboding, with some buildings in ruin, and piles of rubble lying about for repurposing. Some mind flayers hover nearby, supervising.

FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_6.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see each of the enslaved Baldurians are not miserable, but rather all have the same blissed-out, mindless smile, their eyes glazed-over.

FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_0.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_0.text: *All thanks to you. Saviour of the world.*
FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: From wider, we see the line of enslaved baldurians snakes towards where a colossal statue of the player is being  constructed, looming in the mid-distance. Some nautiloids hovering nearby give a sense of its huge scale.

FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_3.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_3.text: *All thanks to you. Saviour of the world.*
FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: From wider, we see the line of enslaved baldurians snakes towards where a colossal statue of the player is being  constructed, looming in the mid-distance. Some nautiloids hovering nearby give a sense of its huge scale.

FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_4.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_4.text: *All thanks to you. Saviour of the world.*
FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: From wider, we see the line of enslaved baldurians snakes towards where a colossal statue of the player is being  constructed, looming in the mid-distance. Some nautiloids hovering nearby give a sense of its huge scale.

FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_7.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_7.text: *All thanks to you. Saviour of the world.*
FinalDecision_Nested_Rule_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: From wider, we see the line of enslaved baldurians snakes towards where a colossal statue of the player is being  constructed, looming in the mid-distance. Some nautiloids hovering nearby give a sense of its huge scale.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_17.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Various Baldurians cower or stand ready to defend themselves from Mind Flayers. They grimace, awaiting the final assault... 

... but it does not come. The Mind Flayers no longer attack, but keep the survivors surrounded, watching and waiting.

The Baldurians look up in terror and awe as a huge shadow falls.
InternalNodeContext: Outcome if the player urges the Emperor to take the power of the Netherbrain

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_12.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_12.text: *A new beginning, ushered in by your hand.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: The source of the shadow - the Netherbrain - descends towards the streets, blotting out the sun. Baldurians cringe in fear.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_19.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Netherbrain's descent slows as it nears street level. Damaged buildings tremble, and a great cloud of dust fills the air. The watching Mind Flayers part ranks. From the dust cloud -

- The Player strides forth, with Enthralled Companions. They clear a path to the Baldurians like an honour guard. A final figure drifts forward as the dust settles. The Emperor.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_6.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_6.text: *The Emperor, once so-named as an insult, now dwarfs his title. He is a god-king-in-waiting, claimant to the stars and all who dwell amongst them.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_15.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor casts his gaze over his terrified subjects. A pulse of psionic energy pulses from him. The Baldurians wince and drop to their knees in supplication, as do any companions.The only non-illithid still on their feet is the player, who glances around - 

- then looks to the Emperor, questioning.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_16.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_16.text: *But an emperor needs a right hand. A conqueror needs a general. And who could be better suited, than you?*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player reads the Emperor's expression, then glances at all those bowing before them. companions and NOTABLE SURVIVING NPCS amongst the masses, all bowing. The player  turns back to the Emperor.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_7.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_7.text: Accept your calling. Become the Emperor's sword arm, and lead his nascent legions across Faerûn and beyond.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor nods, and sends out another pulse of psionic power. The masses stand, watching the playerexpectantly. The player turns, purposeful, and strides away, followers in-tow.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: CUT TO: Another part of the city. The aftermath of a hard-fought battle between Githyanki warriors and Newborn Illithids. Only a few bloodied and spent Gith remain alive. A Gith General skewers a prone mind flayer on the ground with her silver sword, then turns and surveys the slaughter -

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_18.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Suddenly the general takes a thrown spear through the abdomen. She collapses, struggling to get back up. Her remaining troops raise weapons -

- a mass of enthralled Baldurians surround them from several directions. The gith are hopelessly outnumbered. The gith general, hunched over and mortally wounded, raises her scimitar and snarls defiantly.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: MATCH CUT TO: the same gith general's face, her expression now slack and lifeless. Her severed head is held in the player's fist by the hair.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_3.context:
CinematicNodeContext: We see the player, the victorious general, offering the head to the Emperor who stands before a statue of Balduran - himself.

Far overhead, a final few red dragons flee through a portal.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_20.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_20.text: *The first victory of many. The githyanki have fled, but they cannot hide. No one can.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor places a hand on the player's shoulder. They look each other in the eyes, partners. They connect psionically.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_5.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_5.text: *Together, none can resist you. After all, you were made for each other.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: For a brief moment, the player sees the Emperor as their Guardian once again. They smile at each other.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_9.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_9.text: Why merely serve, when you could rule? Attack the Emperor.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player produces a dagger and moves to strike the emperor in the heart, but their hand freezes mid-lunge as psionics grip them. They exert themselves, to no avail. The Emperor gives a small, disappointed shake of the head.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_13.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_13.text: *And you were doing so well. No matter - another will serve in your stead. As for you...?
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player's eyes widen as they find  themselves compelled to reverse their grip on the dagger, holding it as if to thrust ito into their own chest. They strain, as if to resist...

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_2.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player rams the dagger towards their own chest. Hard cut to black just as it makes impact.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_1.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_1.text: This was a mistake. Walk away from the Emperor.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player turns and walks away, only to be gripped by a blast of psionic magic, and spun around to face the emperor once again.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_24.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_24.text: *You cast your lot with the Emperor. Turning your back is no longer an option. What shall it be?*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_8.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilEmperor_8.text: The Emperor has forced your hand - kill him.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilGale_1.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilGale_1.text: *They bow before you, prayers and pleas mingling into a single, submissive drone. But you are not here to yoke them - you come to set them free.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilGale_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale turns his back on the awestruck, kneeling crowd and spreads his arms wide, dark energy crackling around him as he begins to float upwards.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilGale_2.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilGale_2.text: *The Absolute lies broken at your feet. The first god to fall - but not, perhaps, the last.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilGale_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot from behind Gale's back, upwards at the heavens. With a gesture Gale splits the dark skies, opening a rift through which brilliant, otherworldly light spills.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilGale_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: As Gale ascends, he lifts a hand to his head. CLOSE UP as, almost idly, he caresses the earring gifted to him by Mystra - then unclasps it, allowing it to fall behind him as he rises with a fleet of nautiloids lining the way before him.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilGale_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: CLOSE-UP as we stay with the earring, tracing its path downwards as it begins to break up, fragmenting into streamers of blue Mystran magic. Almost gently, they descend upon the watching crowds. As the spell settles on them, they rise to their feet, and begin to riot. The streets roil with anarchy as the enraged mob tears down the tokens of the old religions - statues, clerics, temples.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilGale_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: A single magial streamer settles on a statue of Mystra, facing gazing upwards, and runs down her cheek like a single tear - before the statue is torn down and broken upon the cobbles.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilGale_5.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilGale_5.text: *The heavens are waiting. And you have work to do.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilGale_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Final shot of the wide split in the heavens, a fleet of nautiloids preparing to pass through

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: From atop the Netherbrain, the Dark Urge looks down towards the streets below.InternalNodeContext: Outcome if a Dark Urge player

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_38.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_38.text: *A thousand thousand respiring things lie below, pointing up at you, gasping their last.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge turns towards their love interest and companions, if any are present.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_31.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_31.text: We could have had victory. We could have had each other. Instead you have chosen madness.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_65.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark urge reaches forward to kiss their love interest one last time, but there is a dagger between them as well.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs their love interesrt while kissing them

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_6.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_6.text: I... I am glad it was you. No other blade would have sufficed.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_59.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_59.text: I... I'm coming to you, Lady Shar. Embrace me.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_16.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_16.text: I... I thought we were going to save each other...

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_63.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_63.text: You made me want to live...

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_46.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_46.text: I should have killed you when I had the chance...

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_45.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_45.text: No... no, this can't be... I can't - you can't... no...

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_48.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_48.text: No... We were meant to do this together...

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs their love interesrt while kissing them

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs their love interesrt while kissing them

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs their love interesrt while kissing them

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs their love interesrt while kissing them

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs their love interesrt while kissing them

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs their love interesrt while kissing them

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_15.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_15.text: You do not want to see what is to come. Death is my reward for your service.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: If not already killed, LOVE INTEREST, if present, is the last to go. One last look, and over they go. DARK URGE smiles.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Psionics overcome the compaions. Horror washes over their faces, but they walk to the edge nonetheless, and step into the void.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_7.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_7.text: *Time for the final act. Your tragedy has become mankind's.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge goes to the edge of the brain, and 'falls' off - looking like they're committing suicide initially from the way it's framed - but they will actually fly in the next shot

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge was actually not in danger, but slowly, serenely, float down to the Gate like the Angel of Death. Perhaps the sky starts to darken even further.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: The companions are psionically deposited on the ground with a little less grace than durge. Companions give a tragic last look towards Durge, then flee.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: The companions are psionically deposited on the ground with a little less grace than durge. Companions give a tragic last look towards Durge, then flee.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge uses the brain to trigger a city-wide dagger explosion. Daggers burst from the chest of civilians, flaming fist, and mindflayers alike. They scream in agony as they float just above the ground, their blood dripping to cover the floor in crimson.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_30.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_30.text: *The hivemind allows you to feel each kill as if it were your own. The pleasure is almost too much to bear.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dagger explosion is shown through the form of many of the ‘bloody dagger’ effects shown in shots of civilians. Their blood pools beneath their feet.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_77.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge walks past piles of bodies, and some suspended in the daggered explosions created by the brain -

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge psionically yanks the brain back down, causing it to obey

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_67.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_67.text: *As you think upon the resplendent deaths to come, Father sends a premonition of your red-radiant destiny.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Durge takes their seat upon the throne once again. Closing their eyes, the Dark Urge vignette blackens the screen.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade in to The Dark Urge opening their eyes. They stand alone, in a lake of blood that stretches as far as the eye can see with black void surrounding it. They are walking off into the infinite gore they have pooled, underneath a starless sky.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_12.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_12.text: *You are the end. The last creature living, with all else felled by your hand. Alone, amidst their gall, at the close of eternity.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_18.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_18.text: *Then, and only then, Father will be proud.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_13.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_13.text: Run from me when we land. We will meet again at the end of days, when I shall come for you.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_14.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_14.text: Why? You... you betrayed me. You betrayed yourself. Don't do this.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_32.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_32.text: We were meant to save the world - not damn it. You and I. Together.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_54.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_54.text: No... we were so close. I stayed by your side. Dark Lady forgive me...

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_47.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_47.text: No... we won. We saved the world. And now you'd doom it again?

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_60.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_60.text: This is the world you wanted? You were better than this. You were better...

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_76.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_76.text: So, you chose this. Over Baldur's Gate, over your friends, over us... you chose this...

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_83.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_83.text: My darling love! You were perfect, my sweet. And now the world is ours to rule.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_82.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_82.text: Everything we fought for, everything we survived... only for you to succumb to madness right as we prevail...? Oak Father forgive us...

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_5.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_5.text: My magnificent love - do you see now what you are capable of? Such terrible beauty. Such beautiful devastation.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_79.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_79.text: *You have no one left to judge you for your sins.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_11.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_11.text: *But aren't we all alone, in the end, when we die?*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_73.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_73.text: *But there is one who deserves the honour of your first death. The beginning of your end.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge turns towards their companions, if any are present.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_25.speaker: Lae'zel
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_25.text: The mask of sanity slips away at last. I should have purged you when I had the chance - for the sake of us all.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_0.speaker: Jaheira
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_0.text: I never expected to die of old age. But if you're waiting for me to beg for my life - we both will.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_3.text: You are glorious. And together, we will be magnificent.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_44.speaker: Wyll
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_44.text: I thought the best of you. The foolish hopes of a man who thought he had an ally - a friend.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_9.speaker: Shadowheart
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_9.text: No... we were so close. I stayed by your side. Dark Lady forgive me...

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_22.speaker: Shadowheart
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_22.text: No... we won. We saved the world. And now you'd doom it again?

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_64.speaker: Gale
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_64.text: So, the beast within you wins at last. And what a prize - a ruined world for a poisoned soul. Congratulations.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_70.speaker: Astarion
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_70.text: I wish I could blame destiny, or tell myself that Bhaal was just too powerful to resist, but no... No, you chose this.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_4.speaker: Astarion
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_4.text: Maybe this is what I deserve, for all my sins. A front row seat at the end of the world...

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_2.speaker: Astarion
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_2.text: Darling, you were perfect! And now, finally, the whole world lies at our feet.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_80.speaker: Minsc
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_80.text: ...Be still, Boo. Think of our friends.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_81.speaker: Minsc
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_81.text: Do what you will, demon. But you had best do it in one blow.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_84.speaker: Halsin
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_84.text: It was all for naught then. We brought the world back from the brink, only for you to cast it all away.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_24.speaker: Karlach
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_24.text: I... I thought you'd change. I thought you'd resist. What a fool I was.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_37.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_37.text: *You shall soon amass an illithid army to bring slaughter across Faerûn. But now, it is time to unleash Bhaal's adoration upon his beloved city.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_66.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_66.text: *Your brain beyond brains calculates precisely how many creatures await death below. Ninety-seven thousand, six hundred and two.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_1.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_1.text: *And two hundred thousand and twelve rats. There is no death too small for Bhaal, after all.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_26.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_26.text: *You are half an Illithid. Half a God. Below the gawking onlookers line up to die.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_50.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilDurge_50.text: *Your brain, split, possessed, carved, many-times wormed, need think only one thought now. You know the one, Bhaalspawn.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart_1.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart_1.text: *Which path calls to you, darkness or light?*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart begins to walk through the awestruck kneeling crowd, eyes fixed ahead as she passes

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart_4.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart_4.text: *Who you were, or what you may yet become?*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Profile shot from the right, from the crowd's POV - SH's magic flares up as she walks, lining her in Shar's black and purple. Reverse shot from the other side, her magic now flaring Selune's radiant white.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart_0.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart_0.text: *But Shar and Selûne's war need not be yours. Their fracture only weakened them both, and pitted their followers against each other.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH approaches a line of priests who are shoved roughly to their knees before her. Each wears the insignia of either Shar or Selune, though they've become hopelessly muddled as the crowd hems them in from each side.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart_3.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart_3.text: *You shall indulge their ancient follies no longer. A new church will rise; united, in your image, and blessed with the blood of the faithless.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart smiles, her magic flickering between dark and light before ultimately melding into a twilight grey with accents of each.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart_2.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart_2.text: *Your heart swells with silver and shadow alike, and the undying love of countless followers. At last, you are whole.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilShadowheart_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart gestures at the waiting crowd, who fall upon the terrified clerics with nails and teeth. As we pull up and away from the shining figure in the midst of the seething mass of bodies, we see the Netherbrain pulse with power high above - and the sky itself take on the mingled colour's of Shadowheart's new church.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_0.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_0.text: *A good githyanki knows when the battle is won.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel looks over the awed, kneeling  people of the city,  Hovering above them - the NETHERBRAIN - still, awaiting her word.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_4.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_4.text: *But she knows, too, when the battlefield has simply changed.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Psionics pulse. Two githyanki warriors, bloodied from battle, rise from the back of the kneeling crowd and loyally join her at her side as an honour guard. Lae'zel  then turns her back on the crowds, gazing outwards instead - UPWARDS.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_9.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: WIDE SHOT of a fleet of nautiloids, hanging eerily suspended in the sky.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_3.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_3.text: *But she knows, too, that a weapon should never be cast aside so long as it still might be used.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: The nautilods begin to power up, turning their noses outwards. With a gesture, Lae'zel summons a red dragon and mounts it, soaring upwards to join the fleet.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_7.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_7.text: *A good githyanki is loyal to her liege.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot facing Lae'zel on dragonback, grim determination on her face as portals begin to snap to life all around her.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_5.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_5.text: *But she knows, too, that there is no such thing as loyalty to a lie.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: She raises her fist - and brings it swooping, gesturing her fleet of nautilods through the portals.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_1.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_1.text: *A good githyanki fights all her life for the right to return home.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_1.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A long room, the edges blurred by shadow. A solitary figure sits the throne at the other end - QUEEN VLAAKITH of the githyanki, looking utterly bored.
The camera creeps towards her as she begins to stir herself at some disruption.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_10.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close-up on Vlaakith's, eyes growing wide with alarm as her face is suddenly awash with the colour of illithid portals.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_8.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_8.text: Hail Queen Vlaakith. The last of Her name.
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vlaakith's expression finally turn to fear - then we CUT TO BLACK.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_6.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_6.text: *But she knows, too, that some things must be done in her prince's name - but not by his hand.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilLaezel_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: She raises her fist - and brings it swooping, gesturing her fleet of nautilods through the portals.

FinalDecision_Nested_Chaos_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Psionics wash over the masses. They rise to their feet uncertainly. Focus on one of the enthralled, who glances at his neighbour then sucker punches him.  His victim hasn't even hit the ground before the puncher is stabbed in the back by a pitchfork-wielding third baldurian.

FinalDecision_Nested_Chaos_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Assorted quick shots of the crowd turning on each other (verbally and physically), running amok, breaking doors and windows.

FinalDecision_Nested_Chaos_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Back on the player, who watches impassively as the sounds of a riot rise around them. We hear shouting, impacted, tussling. There is a wooshing sound as something ignites and the glow of something burning offscreen illuminates their face.

FinalDecision_Nested_Chaos_3.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_Chaos_3.text: *This was always to be their fate. You just gave them the final nudge they needed.*

FinalDecision_Nested_Chaos_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player watches the unfolding chaos with a look of cool contempt. The glow of the offscreen fires light up their eyes.

FinalDecision_Nested_Chaos_6.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_Chaos_6.text: *By the time the wailing fades and ashes cool, you will be long gone. A shared nightmare amongst those unfortunate enough to survive.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_6.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up of Wyll sitting the throne in Wyrm's Rock, sneering down at something.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_1.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_1.text: *Before, you used to worry what lay behind those smiles. Whether they would kneel for you of their own accord, or at the beckoning of your father.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: We track along a line of patriars cowering at the foot of the throne, illithid guards hovering to either side.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_0.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_0.text: *But you know better, now. What matters is that they do kneel - let the 'why' be for lesser men.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_0.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A pause, and Wyll raises his his hand lazily. With a pulse of psionic power, the patriars before him transform into mind flayers, kneeling before.

If available, Ravengard goes last and most gruesomely, transforming on 'lesser men'.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_2.context: NodeContext: Mizora stands at Wyll's side and smirks

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_5.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_5.text: *For the city, for the Coast, for the entire world - there will be something approaching peace. But first:*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Exterior shot over the city - the NETHERBRAIN, pulsing in obediance to Wyll's command. Portals being to open, lighting up the sky.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_3.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: CLOSE-UP of Wyll, no trace of anything heroic left in his face - only the tyrant.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_4.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_4.text: *Before, you used to worry what lay behind those smiles. Whether they would kneel in honour of your deeds - or in memory of your father's.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_4.context:
CinematicNodeContext: We track along a line of patriars cowering at the foot of the throne, illithid guards hovering to either side.

IF AVAILABLE - RAVENGARD STANDS AT THE END, STARING BACK AT WYLL WITH DEFIANCE

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_7.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_7.text: *But you know better, now. What matters is that they do kneel - let the 'why' be for lesser men.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilWyll_7.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A pause, and Wyll raises his his hand lazily. With a pulse of psionic power, the patriars before him transform into mind flayers, kneeling before.

If available, Ravengard goes last and most gruesomely, transforming on 'lesser men'.
